intro: [WRONG START] Origanum vulgage var. viridulum, commonly known as green oregano, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, oval-shaped leaves that are a vibrant green. The plant produces tiny, pale blue or purple flowers in late spring to early summer. Its aromatic leaves contain essential oils, giving it a distinctively minty and citrusy scent. This variety is often used in cooking and herbal remedies due to its unique flavor profile and medicinal properties.
